404PageContent.title: Page not found
404PageContent.description: The page may have been deleted or there is an error in your link

errorBoundary.title: Something went wrong
errorBoundary.description: Try refreshing the page or come back later

mainPageContent.text1subText: If you are visiting our site, you might have questions about your career development
mainPageContent.text2: We offer you to take an express assessment of potential career setbacks and identify problems that prevent you from successfully advancing up the career ladder
mainPageContent.text3: If you want to learn more about this, <InfoLink>{{goToInfo}}</InfoLink>, if not, <TestLink>{{goToTest}}</TestLink>
mainPageContent.text4: Ready to take a step towards success?
mainPageContent.sectionText: We have predicted four types of setbacks: self-assessment failure, career environment analysis failure, self-presentation management failure, and total failure.
mainPageContent.sectionText1: A failure caused by self-assessment issues prevents a person from realistically evaluating their abilities and aligning them with career space requirements. Such individuals typically have inflated ambitions without proper foundation, i.e., not reflecting their actual professional competence.
mainPageContent.sectionText2: Self-presentation management issues reflect an inability to 'sell' oneself in the job market under desired conditions despite having professional skills. Often, this failure type is rooted in image problems (understood as managing others' perceptions to enhance professional success).
mainPageContent.sectionText3: The next self-marketing technology failure stems from an individual's inability to properly assess requirements imposed by internal and external career environment factors, especially in aggressive environments.
mainPageContent.sectionText4: Total failure disrupts the interconnection of all self-marketing stages, causing individuals to disengage from their professional sphere. Causes include incorrect goal-setting, professional burnout, age-related/existential crises, and personal tragedies.
mainPageContent.sectionText5: Any identified failure requires corrective action. You can work with our specialists or consult your own.

infoPageContent.text1: We have predicted four types of setbacks
infoPageContent.problemText1: Self-assessment failure prevents realistic evaluation of abilities and their alignment with career space requirements. Typically involves inflated ambitions without professional competence basis.
infoPageContent.problemText3: Self-presentation management issues reflect inability to market oneself effectively despite having skills. Often related to image management problems.
infoPageContent.problemText2: Failure to properly assess requirements from internal/external career environment factors, particularly in aggressive environments.
infoPageContent.problemText4: Total failure causes disengagement from professional sphere due to goal-setting errors, burnout, crises, or personal tragedies.
infoPageContent.text2:
Any identified failure requires corrective measures
You can work with our specialists or consult independently

questions.question3: Does your current job satisfy you?
questions.question4: Your job dissatisfaction is related to:
questions.question5: Are you currently achieving your career goals?
questions.question6: Do you have a career development plan?
questions.question7: Do you review and adjust your career plan annually if needed?
questions.question8: Have your career goals changed significantly this year?
questions.question10: Main job selection criterion for you:
questions.question13: Do you have chronic diseases? If yes, specify system:
questions.question18: Are you afraid of job change difficulties?
questions.question19: Do you easily become despondent, sometimes to the point of depression?
questions.question20: Do you lack confidence in your abilities?
questions.question22: Do you sleep poorly, especially recently?
questions.question23: Do colleagues irritate you with repetitive conversations?
questions.question24: Are clients more irritating than colleagues?
questions.question25: Do you handle work tasks without surprises?
questions.question26: Does thinking about work make you want to quit?
questions.question27: Is there nothing new to learn about your job?
questions.question28: Are you suspicious of new things?
questions.question31: Do you prioritize daily task lists?
questions.question32: Do you minimize distractions during work hours?
questions.question33: Does your schedule allow urgent problem-solving?
questions.question34: Do you focus on vital issues first?
questions.question35: Can you say 'no' to protect important tasks?
questions.question36: Are you more interested in other jobs?
questions.question37: Do you pursue goals against objective circumstances?
questions.question38: Do you often leave tasks unfinished?
questions.question39: Do you envy people with light workloads?
questions.question40: Don't understand those not pursuing fast careers?

questions.question2: Commitment-keeping is essential for business reputation

questions.question8: Tolerance is fundamental for social interaction

questions.question16: Accessories should match outfit and setting
questions.question17: Bright makeup is only appropriate for carnivals
questions.question18: Restrained color schemes indicate good taste
questions.question19: Business style requires strict appearance standards
questions.question20: Comfort matters more than dress requirements
questions.question24: Communication etiquette is vital for social success
questions.question25: Manipulation is always bad in business
questions.question33: You prefer face-to-face communication over digital
questions.question34: You adapt quickly to new teams
questions.question37: You limit contacts to pleasant people
questions.question40: You always understand reactions to your behavior

questions.question7: You chose profession based on family/friends' advice
questions.question10: You felt destined for this profession
questions.question11: You chose profession for ease of study
questions.question17: Believe you have more to learn
questions.question23: Chose profession based on desire and developable skills
questions.question29: Dislike profession but continue family business
questions.question30: Love profession which is family business
questions.question31: Know salary range in your profession
questions.question34: Understand position requirements in your field
questions.question38: See career growth within one organization

testResults.allCoolText: Express analysis showed no career setbacks. You're using your potential effectively and considering environmental factors. Wishing you continued success!
testResults.allBadText: Analysis revealed Total Failure - issues with self-assessment, presentation, and environment analysis. Possible causes: wrong profession choice, burnout, crises, or personal tragedy.
testResults.allBadSubText: Our specialists can provide recommendations if needed.

registrationForm.keyQuestionField: Are you satisfied with your career development?
